intro: Oh, y_c! It's so good to see you. I hope you've been having a good evening!
Mm.. actually- do you think you could help me with something?
I've been trying to decorate the camp and I wanted to know which you prefer, purple flowers or golden flowers?
purple: Oh, really? Let me put them up here and see how they look...
Oh, wow, they look fantastic! They make the Leader's Den look quite regal!
Thanks y_c, it means a lot!
golden: Oh, really? Let me put them up here and see how they look...
Oh, I see now! These golden flowers on the Medicine Cat's den really give it this bright but comforting look.
Thanks y_c, it means a lot!

intro: l_n... What do you think of them?
Their leadership style, the choices they've made ... Would you have done it differently, if you were in that position?
I'm just curious. What you think of who's in charge could reveal a lot about your character.
support: But do you really mean that?
Or are you just worried about what would happen if you answered differently?
diss: Hm. It takes a lot of guts to admit that. Respect to you, y_c.
Though, maybe not the smartest to admit while l_n is standing right behind you ...
refuse: Oh, come on. It's all just in the spirit of inquiry.
Do you really consider your opinion so important that it needs protecting ...?

intro: I bet the first pick of the freshkill pile that you'll have three kits!
r_c thinks there'll be five though. Hehe, what do you think?
agree_tc: Ha, I knew you would agree!
Say, what do you think of t_c -kit for a name? It has a great ring to it!
agree_rc: Aw, really? Well, I guess some cats want a bigger family ...
Say, what do you think of t_c -kit for a name? It has a great ring to it!
disagree: Really? How many were you thinking, then?
small: One? Hm ... Seems a little lonely, no?
Still, I guess if that's what you want.
mid: Four! Now that's a good, round, even number.
You'd have one for each role! A warrior, a mediator, a medicine cat, and a queen.
That way, you'd really always be taken care of. Hehe!
big: With ten kits, you could have, like, a whole Clan to yourself ... A whole army, even!
I'm not sure if r_q would be too happy about it though ...

intro: [t_c is pawing at the snow covered ground, thoughtfully.]
Oh, y_c. Good morning. It seems like that snowstorm last night left us a gift.
You know, it's utterly shocking that all of those tiny little snowflakes come together to cover the earth around us. I suppose snowflakes prove there's power in numbers.
They're... much like Clans in that regard. On our own, we're not that strong; we can be wiped away easily. Together, however, when we work together, we're a force of nature.
What do you think, y_c?
profound: Not many cats have the patience to listen to my pontificating ... Let alone sincerely appreciate it.
You're one of a kind, y_c.
notserious: But, isn't that all life is? A search for meaning in the otherwise meaningless?
Far be it from me to stop you from interpreting the snow however you wish.
You do you, y_c, and I'll do me. Freedom of thought. That's what life's really all about.

intro: Psst, y_c. I heard a rumor that n_r1 totally has a crush on n_r2. Isn't that crazy?
where: Hmph. You're no fun at all.
knewit: Oh, really? Because I totally just made that up just now.
But if you have actual gossip, then by all means, spill!
I swear, your secrets are safe with me ... hehehe.
madeup: Hmph. And so what if I did? Is it such a crime for me to want to add some entertainment to my Clanmates' lives?
C'mon, you can't deny you love a little gossip now and then!

intro: You killed them, didn't you?
inquire: [You ask t_c what could have given them that idea.]
I don't know ... Call it a hunch.
You certainly didn't seem too torn up when they died, that's for sure.
play_dumb: Come on, don't be coy. I think we both know what I'm referring to, here.
threaten: [You subtly unsheath your claws and bare your teeth at t_c, hoping they'll get the message.]
... Is that supposed to intimidate me, or something?
mourning_secretly: Oh ... Oh, y_c, I'm so sorry. I didn't realize ...
They say we all process grief differently, but I guess I never really believed it.
I can't believe I accused you of something so horrible ...
I guess I'm just still not over their death myself, yet.
If you ever want to talk about it with someone, I'm here. They really were a special cat.
[t_c head-bumps you gently before walking off. That was way too close, but it seems they're none the wiser.]
no_proof: Maybe not ... But, still, I don't know any cat to not at least be shaken by the loss of their own Clanmate.
I might not be able to prove anything yet, but I've got my eye on you, y_c. Mark my words, soon enough, you will get what's coming to you.
[t_c stalks off, tail lashing. Better make sure your tracks are well covered ...]
play_dumber: ['Still don't know what you're talking about ...']
This was supposed to be a big 'gotcha' moment ... But, if you really don't know what I'm talking about, then ...
My apologies, y_c. I think I've gotten the wrong cat.
[t_c turns around and slinks away, embarrassed. Still, they must be on your trail.]
[Best keep an eye on them, lest they ever come back with more proof.]
back_off: Good, because it isn't working. If anything, you've only now further cemented your guilt in my mind.
I might not be able to prove anything yet, but I've got my eye on you, y_c. Mark my words, soon enough, you will get what's coming to you.
[t_c stalks off, tail lashing. Better make sure your tracks are well covered ...]
overt_threat: ['You better drop this, now, or you'll be next.']
Right ... Just forget I said anything, then.
[t_c trips over their paws a bit as they stumble out of the den. Best keep an eye on them to make sure they don't squeal ...]

intro: Why are kits so difficult...
y_c, I didn't see you there.
Oh, please, don't worry about me. Though, I wish I had an extra set of paws.
help: Wait, you'll help? Really? Hehe, thank you! It really means a lot-
HEY! r_k, NO! Don't touch that!
[Seems the two of you have your paws full ...]
dont_help: [You leave to go take care of your own business right as t_c is tackled by a horde of kittens.]
Ack - it's fine! Totally holding it together!

intro: Hey, I need an opinion, if you're up for it.
Do you think that t_p_positive would like this flower? I saw it the other day and it reminded me of them, but I'm worried they won't like it...

choice2.text: I don't think they'd like it.

they_love_it: Really? Thanks for the help! I appreciate it.
they_dont_like_it: Really? Yeesh, good thing I didn't end up going through with it.

intro: [t_c walks up to you, tail lashing wildly.]
y_c, I don't know how you manage it, but I'm not surprised you have to cheat in our training sessions.
It makes sense you can't naturally compare to a clanborn cat, but it doesn't mean you can show me up in front of d_n, and especially not l_n!
defend_yourself: [You hurl every insult you can imagine at t_c. You even make up some that didn't exist previously.]
Oh yeah? Well you're a - uh ... Gah! You're not even worth the mental energy!
[t_c runs off, tail between their legs. What a mouse-brain!]
say_nothing: [t_c sneers at you one last time before stalking off without giving you a chance to reply.]
[You feel weirdly proud of yourself for not having stooped down to their level.]

intro: [t_c is sharing tongues with t_m in the clearing.]
[Who would have the heart to interrupt such a display of coupley bliss?]
interrupt_them: [You prod t_c with the side of your paw, demanding that they pay attention to you.]
Tch, y_c, can't you take a hint? I'm in the middle of something here!
t_m and I barely get any time together ... Is what you have to say really so important?
leave_them_alone: [Certainly not you. You leave the cats alone.]

intro: [t_c is sitting outside the nursery, their expression shifting between a look of awe and determination as they watch l_n move about the camp.]
ask_why: [You ask the kit why they're so fascinated with l_n.]
Oh ... Well, I wanna be just like them someday!
Smart ... Powerful ... The boss of everyone ....
[Yeesh. Kit's already plotting to take over the Clan!]
leave_them_alone: [You decide to leave the young cat to their own devices.]

intro: Listen, I'm not the type of cat who likes to rake up old bones, but r_w totally cheated on their warrior assessment!
how_do_you_know: Just call it a hunch. That assessment isn't easy, there's no way they could've passed legitimately.
Even six-moon-old apprentices are more qualified than they are!
no_way: Fine, whatever, keep living in ignorance. I'm just trying to state the facts.
i_agree: Right?! How do you think they did it, because I have a few theories.
I think they somehow convinced d_n to give them a way easier assessment than usual. Or, maybe they stole a bunch of prey from the freshkill pile and pretended it was theirs.
Whatever the case, I know what they are ... Glad to know you do, too.

intro: Hey, y_c, dare me to jump off the warrior's den!
dare: [With a devilish grin, t_c scrabbles up the warrior's den and careens off with a flying leap, tail helicoptering.]
[They land right on top of a pile of moss r_c had been meticulously gathering, sparking an argument.]
[Yeesh ... Better leave the scene before you get roped into this!]
refuse: What? Why in StarClan's name not?
But that's what's fun about it!

intro: I found this super cool cave network just outside the territory ... Wanna come explore it with me later?
What was I doing outside the territory ...?
Psh, do you seriously expect me to spend my entire life on c_nClan territory? How could any cat be happy being trapped like that?
That's basically just like being a kittypet, but with extra steps.
Now, are you coming with me, or not?
go_with: Hehehe. Glad I could help open up your mind!
I swear, y_c, this is actually going to blow c_nClan territory out of the water.
[The journey is short. t_c leads you to a dazzling network of caves just outside the twolegplace.]
[t_c was right. The caves' beauty really is breathtaking ...]
[You return to camp with your heart racing, thrilled by the experience.]
refuse: I thought you were cooler than this, but if you want to live out the rest of your life on c_nClan territory, that's good with me.
[Later that night, you see them slip out of the camp with r_c, apparently having replaced you as a travel companion.]
[Stupid cave system probably isn't even that cool anyways ...]

intro: y_c! y_c! Gimme a badger ride, c'mon, pleeease?
r_q is too busy! I need you to play with me!
accept: [Before you even get a chance to prepare, t_c tackles you from behind, squealing with delight as they clamber onto your shoulders.]
decline: Hmph! Meanie! I'll go find someone else to play with, then!
[t_c sticks their tongue out at you for good measure before bounding off to go bother r_c for a ride.]
[For such a small cat, they're certainly not lacking in attitude.]

intro: Hmph. When are they gonna let us out of this stuffy old nursery?
I want to explore! And I just know, if they let us battle, I could be the best warrior this clan has ever seen!!! I could probably take down two or three o_cClan cats, all by myself.
Hey ... maybe we could sneak out!
Yeah, I know it's against the rules! What are you, a scaredy-cat?
lets_do_it: Hehehe, alright! I knew you weren't really a scaredy-cat!
[You and t_c devise an epic plan for how you're going to escape the nursery.]
[You spin tales of the amazing adventures you two will go on, the sights you'll see, the enemies you'll defeat.]
[It's incredible! ... Or, it would be, if r_q didn't overhear the entire thing.]
[You earn a scolding from the queen, but it was worth it to use your imagination with t_c for a little while.]
i_dont_know: Hmph. I should've known you'd be a chickenheart.
How are you ever gonna be a brave warrior if you can't even do this with me?

choice22.text: Maybe I don't wanna be a warrior!

dont_wanna_be_warrior: Don't wanna be a warrior? Like ... You wanna be a meddy cat, or something?
Why in StarClan's name would you want that?! Do you just wanna be trapped inside of camp forever?
Fine, then. I'll go find someone else to help me, if that's how you feel!
[t_c scampers off. They probably won't try to involve you in any more of their schemes any time soon.]

intro: Hey, y_c! Wanna hear about all the things I like?
I like fresh-kill and leaves and puddles and rain and rainclouds and normal clouds and my friends and c_nClan and fighting and playing and sleeping and ...
[Oh, StarClan, t_c is going on forever, and you really have some stuff you need to get to today.]
stay_and_listen: [You plaster on a brave smile as t_c continues on their tirade.]
Plus, I like fishes, even though r_k thinks fishes are yucky, and I like snowflakes, and clouds, and flowers, and -- OOH, you wanna know what I REALLY like?
what: [t_c headbutts your leg with a sweet purr.]
I'm just having so much fun talking to you!
walk_away: Wait, where are you going? I wasn't finished yet!
[You end up getting your task done, but out of the corner of your eye, you can see little t_c slinking back into the nursery, tail drooping.]

intro: y_c, we're always gonna be best friends, aren't we?
Promise me that, no matter what happens, we'll stay friends forever and ever and ever and ever and ever until the end of time!

choice2.text: Forever sounds like a long time ...

i_promise: Heehee! I knew it! Nothing's ever gonna tear us apart!
And if anything ever does, I'll drive it away with my killer battle moves! Rawr!
[t_c pounces on you, and the two of you play fight, breathless and giggling.]
forever_sounds_long: W-What? Well, yeah, I know it is, but ...
That's how long I want us to stay together!
Do you not think we can stay friends that long?
[t_c tucks their tail over their paws and stares apprehensively.]

intro: I dare you to go up to r_c and call them a huge stinky dung-face!
You don't want to? Too bad! I already dared it!
And if you don't, I'll tell everyone in the nursery that you're the huge stinky dung-face!
The choice is yours ... Hehehe!
okay: [You find r_c and repeat the words to them, somewhat half-heartedly.]
[They seem confused, like you genuinely hurt their feelings ...]
[ ... But, when you report back to t_c, they're downright thrilled.]
I wonder what else I can get you to do ...
no_way: Okay! If that's what you choose, stinky dung-face! Ahahahhaa!
[They're not really gonna call you that forever ... right?]

intro: y_c, do you ever get scared?
yes: Hmph. Don't you worry! You don't have to be scared when I'm around!
As soon as I'm big enough, I'm gonna get really strong and chase all the bad guys away!
I can be brave. I can keep you safe!
no: Really? Like, not ever? Not even once?
Not even during a loud thunderstorm, or when you're found out for doing something naughty?
Wow ... You must be really brave, y_c.
I wanna be just like that one day!

intro: What do you think our warrior names are gonna be?
I hope my name ends in '-claw'!!! That's a super tough name, isn't it?
A name to strike fear into the hearts of all my enemies! Rrraahhh!
What do you want your name to end in?
flame: -flame? Hey, that's a pretty good one! I forgot about that one!
Is it too late for me to change my answer?
claw: It could be kind of cool, though. Us, having matching names! Could you imagine?
We could be, like, a super-scary battling duo! Rawrr!
flower: -flower? Who do you think you're gonna be scaring off with a name like that?

intro: y_c, family means forever, right? We're always gonna be together?
We're not gonna turn out like those siblings that fight all the time and stop liking each other, are we?
of_course_not: Heh. Of course not. It was silly of me to even ask.
Why would I ever stop liking you?
anything_possible: W-What? You don't really mean that, do you?
What would ever happen to make me stop liking you?

intro: Hey, y_c ... is it really true that you can talk to StarClan?
Whoa! That's so cool! What does StarClan say that I'm gonna do? Am I gonna be strong? Am I destined for greatness?
yes: Really?! StarClan said that about me?
So, what does this mean? Am I a prophecy cat? Am I gonna save the Clan?!
I can't wait to tell l_n about this!
[t_c dashes out of the den with an excited squeal.]
[You better tell them the truth, before they land themself in a whole world of disappointment.]
no: What? Seriously? StarClan said that about me?
Hmph. Well, what does StarClan know anyways?
I'll show them ... I'll become the strongest warrior this Clan has ever seen! Then, StarClan will be begging to make prophecies about me!
[t_c stalks out of the medicine den with a huff. They probably won't be asking about StarClan again any time soon.]
doesnt_work_like_that: ... It doesn't work like that? Awh. That's no fun.
Well, if StarClan ever mentions me, you'll let me know, won't you?

intro: Did you see r_c earlier today, y_c? Oh, StarClan, it was the funniest thing ever!
They mistook a twig for a snake and flew, like, five fox-lengths into the air! Hahahaha!
hilarious: Hahaha, I knew you'd appreciate it!
Say, I know this place out on the territory with some huge sticks ... Think we can make them do it again?
Maybe they'll go six fox-lengths this time!
not_very_funny: No? Since when were you above that type of humor?
You gotta lighten up, y_c. You don't have to take everything so seriously all the time! It'll give you gray hairs.

intro: Do me a favor and put me on the border patrol, y_c? I need to feel the wind in my fur. I've been going crazy, cooped up in camp.
accept_request: Heh, thanks! Knew I could count on you.
[t_c leads the border patrol out of camp, impressing everyone with their initiative and vigor.]
[Might have to remember them as a good candidate for an apprentice later ...]
deny_request: [You tell t_c that you don't appreciate being ordered around like an apprentice.]
Are you serious right now? I thought I was talking to my deputy, not my dictator!
Whatever ... Guess I'll just keep rotting in camp, then, if that's what makes you happy.
[t_c slinks away muttering curses. You'll have to remember their insolence for later.]

intro: y_c, when do you think we'll get to fight in a real warrior battle?
I know we've been practicing our fighting moves, but practice is nothing compared to the real thing.
I'm just itching to tear into some o_cClan fur! That'll show them how a real c_nClan cat does it!

choice1.text: I hope we get to battle right away!

choice2.text: I hope we never have to battle ...

hope_battle_right_away: Say, maybe there's a way we can both get what we want!
You can be an o_cClan warrior, and I'll be the c_nClan warrior.
Ready? I'll give you a running start!
hope_never_battle: Huh? Really? How do you ever expect to be a decent warrior with that attitude?
I dunno what type of stuff m_n's been teaching you, but maybe you should come and train with me and t_mn sometime.
Then, you'll learn just how fun fighting can be!

intro: [t_c tackles you from behind.]
Rahhh! o_cClan warrior, feel my wrath!
Hehe, don't worry! It's just me, y_c. Did I scare you?
That's a move tm_n just taught me. Cool, huh? I can't wait to try it out for real!
Has m_n taught you anything cool yet?
yes: Hehe, alright! You'll have to show me sometime!
Hey, maybe we can organize some kind of awesome joint-training session with all of the apprentices! That way, we can make sure all our bases are covered.
I bet I could get r_a on board, at least!
not_really: Really? Wow, I never realized that m_n was such a crappy mentor!
If you ever wanna learn some moves, I could always teach you!
We could have our own little training sessions. It'd be like tm_n was your mentor-by-proxy!

intro: y_c, t_l won't play with me! Will you go tell them that they have to?

choice3.text: Why won't they play with you?

yes: [You chide t_c's sibling for excluding them and tell them that they have to let t_c participate in the game.]
Ha! Take that! Now, you can't get mad at me for cheating anymore!
And you're never getting that moss-ball back, either!
[Yeesh ... Seems like t_c was actually the bully all along!]
[You'll really need to have a talk with them about how to be a good playmate.]
no: What? You won't? But that's not fairrrr!
[t_c stalks across the nursery to go have a pout.]
[But, as soon as r_q suggests a game of moss-ball, their troubles are suddenly forgotten.]
why_wont_they_play: Hmph. Because they're a big baby, is why!
All I did was hide their moss-ball, and now they think I'm a cheater and refuse to play!
[Yeesh ... Seems like t_c was actually the bully all along!]
[You scold them for their actions and demand that they return the moss-ball to t_l.]
[t_c stalks across the nursery to go have a pout.]
[But, later, you see them shyly return the moss-ball to their littermate with a timid apology.]
[By the end of the day, the two siblings are playing together like normal again.]

intro: ... Who are you?
[Is your own sibling seriously pretending not to know you?!]
confront: [You tell them to cut it out, as everyone knows the two of you are family.]
Psh ... Alright, alright. But could you stop hanging around so much? You're harshing my vibe!
Just because we're siblings, doesn't mean we have to hang out all the time. We're not in the nursery anymore.
insult: [You call t_c a mean nickname that you invented when both of you were kits.]
... Psh. Whatever! I don't even care!
Go find some other friends to hang out with!
[t_c looks away, eyes swimming with hurt and regret.]
walk_away: [You walk away as coldly as possible. If t_c doesn't want anything to do with you today, then fine. So be it.]
[But, when you look back over your shoulder, you catch them watching you go, eyes swimming with hurt and regret ...]
[It seems your sibling might actually care more about you than you anticipated.]

intro: [You notice that t_c isn't asking like their usual, energetic self. You ask them what's wrong.]
*Sigh* Oh, it's nothing really ...
It's just that ... Sometimes, I feel so behind my denmates. Not just in training, but in everything!

Everybody else seems to already have everything figured out. What they want to do with their lives, their places in the clan, who they're going to become mates with ... I just don't know any of that stuff!
assure: [You tell t_c to keep their chin up, as cats their age have less figured out than it seems.]
I guess I never even considered that other apprentices could feel the same way that I do.
Thanks for the pep talk, y_c!
[t_c trots off with a new pep in their step and a big smile on their face, clearly pleased with the results of the conversation.]
comfort: [You wrap your tail around t_c's shoulders and purr that they are an amazing young cat who you're sure has a bright future ahead.]
[They smile at you, seeming to appreciate the gesture, but something in their gaze tells you that you still haven't fully assuaged their worries ...]
reality_check: [You tell t_c that they can't run away from the important decisions forever, especially at their age when those decisions are so critical.]
[With every word out of your mouth, their eyes seem to widen more with worry.]
Man ... I guess I really am behind!
Thanks for helping me realize that, y_c ... Even though it multiplied my stress by, like, a thousand.

intro: [t_c approaches you shyly.]
Uhm, hey, y_c. I just had this idea ... Let me know if you think it's stupid, or something, but, well ...
I was thinking, since being your apprentice has been so great, maybe once I graduate, I could request my full name to be ... after you?
Sorry if it's kind of a weird idea. You don't have to say yes!
love_that: R-Really? Great! I'll go and tell l_n about it right now!
Thanks for being such a great mentor, y_c. I wouldn't trade you for any other cat in the world.
maybe_not: N-No, you're right. Forget it. It was a stupid idea, I don't know why I even asked.

intro: Surprise assessment, y_c! What's the best way to catch a squirrel?
race_up_tree: Whoa! Bold answer, y_c! But I sort of respect that about you.
Yes, the squirrel race is a historic c_nClan tactic. It's super advanced, and dangerous, too.
But the thrill of chasing that squirrel down the trunk of a tree ... StarClan, there's nothing like it.
Maybe I'll teach you sometime! But, ah ... don't tell l_n. Or I'd never hear the end of it! Hehe!
hunting_crouch: I thought I could get you confused, but clearly you're too smart for that, y_c.
with_claws: Hehehe, okay then, smarty-pelt! I'll admit, that was a good one.
But, if you don't actually know the answer, it might be time to start taking your training more seriously ...

intro: Hey, kid! Figured I'd let you take the lead on training today. So, what do you want to learn?
hunting: Wanna catch some food for the Clan, huh? Heh, look at you, being all selfless.
I heard from the hunting patrol that the rivers are running well today ... Whaddaya say to some fishing? Sound great, or sound great?
battling: Ah, now we're talking! You got a warrior's spirit -- I like that about you! It'll serve you well, when you're full grown.
Just make sure to keep your claws sheathed! Hehe!
anything_advanced: Oh, so it's a challenge you're after, huh? Alright! I'll teach you one of the most complicated moves in the book: the bird leap.
Don't get too down on yourself if you don't get it, though! Remember, you asked for this!

intro: Ugh, StarClan, I wish t_p would get off my back all the time!
It's always 't_c, you have to start taking things more seriously', 't_c, listen to the warrior code', 't_c, don't put that in your mouth' -- Like, leave me alone! StarClan!

choice2.text: That's no way to talk about your parent.

choice3.text: t_p is just worried about you!

sounds_tough: *Sigh* I know they're my parent, and all, and they're just trying to look out for me, but sometimes I just wish they would let me be my own cat.
I'm not a kit anymore, they have no right to criticize my choices!
Anyways ... Thanks for listening to me rant, y_c.
Family is always tough, but having a cat like you to talk to always helps.
no_way_to_talk: I don't remember asking for another lecture!
just_worried: Hmph. If I wanted another lecture, I would've just talked to t_p!

intro: Hehehehe ...
[t_c is laughing to themself.]
[They must be remembering a funny joke from earlier.]
ask_about_joke: You wanna know what I was laughing at? Oh, StarClan, was I being that obvious? I didn't think anyone was gonna notice!
r_c told me this hilarious joke earlier, it was like - *snrk* - 'What type of plant sneaks up on you?'
What, you don't think that's funny? Psh, you're no fun!

intro: Hey, who d'ya think's gonna be deputy once d_n is leader?
I guess probably r_w ... they'd probably be good for the job.

choice2.text: I think you'd make a good deputy!

choice3.text: I think I'd make a good deputy!

agree_with_you: Right? They're just such a great fit.
Kinda crazy to think that d_n's gonna be leader one day, though ... I'm not sure if I'm ready for that yet.
you_good_deputy: Psh - me? Hardly! I'd probably find some way to start a war somehow on the first day.
Besides, I'd hate that job. So much responsibility, so much organization - not really my style.
i_good_deputy: You?! I mean, I guess I could see it ...
Certainly not lacking in confidence, are you, y_c?

intro: Hey, boss! Come down to mingle with us common folk? Hehe.
Everything's going just fine around camp, as far as I can tell. There's a leak in the warrior's den that someone should probably get on ... wanna lend a paw?
love_to_help: ... Really? You'd take time out of your big, important day, just to ... help us warriors?
Respect to you, y_c! I'll go grab the brambles.
cant_help: Ah, it's okay, I understand. You have more important things to do than help us lowly warriors.
I'll go grab the brambles by myself, then ...

intro: y_c! Just the cat I was looking for.
You'll be happy to know that I just gathered up some more borage this morning. Which, pop quiz, should help the queens with ... what?
labor_pains: Er ... no, that's not right. Like, at all.
Hm ... maybe now'd be a good time to start your herbal training again ...
milk_production: Hehe, you got it! I should've known you'dve studied up.
If you ever need anything, don't hesitate! I'll be here in the den for ya any time.
nausea: Er ... no, that's not right. Like, at all.
Hm ... maybe now'd be a good time to start your herbal training again ...

intro: *Shudder* So many sick cats ... I gotta get out of this den, y_c. Come gather herbs with me later? We can make it into a contest!
love_to: [t_c's eyes flash a little too intently for it to just be a joke.]
cant: Ah, mouse-dung. That's alright. I understand. You got your own duties to attend to.
[t_c's words are kind, but their eyes betray a disappointment that's a bit too deep to just be friendly.]

intro: Surprise assessment, y_c! What's the best way to dress a wound?
cobwebs_chervil: That's close! But a bit too early. Chervil is only to be used AFTER a wound gets infected, not before.
It won't kill your patient, but still, not good to use valuable herbs on cats who don't need them!
Don't beat yourself up about it, though. You're doing a great job!
yarrow: Whoa, are you crazy?! You want a wounded patient puking all over the medicine den? Because that's just what you're asking for!
*Sigh* Maybe it's time to go over the fundamentals again ...
cobwebs_comfrey: Ding ding ding, you got it right! Hehe, I knew you would.
c_nClan is lucky to have an apprentice as smart as you on our medical staff.

intro: [t_c watches r_w1 and r_w2 laugh together a little ways away, apparently too nervous to join in the conversation.]
help_socialize: [You ask t_c why they don't just go up and talk to the warriors.]
What? And interrupt their conversation?! Are you crazy?
I'd rather die than be subjected to that kind of humiliation ...
Ah, you wouldn't understand, y_c. I'm not confident, like you are. I can't just go chatting with every member of the Clan every moon.

choice11.text: They'd love to talk with you!

sure_love_to_talk: Ah, StarClan. I guess I got nothing to lose.
Well ... Aside from my dignity. But, that's not really worth a ton.
[t_c crosses the camp and awkwardly stands near the warriors until they notice enough to include them in their conversation.]
[Though talk is stilted, t_c looks a lot less lonely than before!]
right: [t_c nods dejectedly and you leave them to continue sitting alone.]
leave_alone: [You decide to leave the poor cat alone.]

intro: Hey, do you think r_w is mad at me?
[You ask t_c why they think the warrior could possibly have a problem with them.]
Well, when they greeted me this morning, they said 'Hello' instead of 'Hi', like they usually do!

choice2.text: Of course they don't hate you.

yes: Ack! Oh, StarClan, I gotta go apologize!
[t_c rushes off to go apologize to the warrior for ... what, exactly?]
[You're not totally sure if t_c even knows.]
no_silly: So, you don't think they hate me?
dont_hate_you: Guess I'm probably freaking out over nothing again, huh?
I just can't help it. My whole life, I've tried so hard to please others, to be the type of cat that folks want to be around ...
The idea of someone not liking me is, like, worse than anything in the world!
Well, maybe not worse than spiders ... But still, you know what I mean!
i_get_it: *Sigh* Thanks for listening to me, y_c.
It's not often that someone lends a listening ear ... Let alone actually understands what I'm saying.
sound_crazy: Oh no ... You're not mad at me too, now, are you?!

intro: [t_c avoids stepping around every puddle in camp after a rain.]
[Confused by this ritual, you ask them why.]
Ah ... If I'm being honest, I can't stand the look of my own reflection, heh.
Plus, it's no good getting my paws wet, either.
thats_sad: Ah ... I probably overshared again, didn't I?
*Sigh* Really gotta get better about doing that ...
youre_beautiful: Huh? Beautiful? Me? Y-You really mean that?
I, um ... I don't know what to say.

intro: r_c told me earlier that 'no other cat in the Clan could do what I do' ... What do you think they meant by that?

choice2.text: How could it not be a compliment?

compliment: *Sigh* I guess I should probably go apologize to them for how I reacted, then ...
If I gave a cat a compliment and they ran away crying, I'd probably be a little confused.
not_compliment: *Sigh* I guess I should probably go apologize to them for how I reacted, then ...
If I gave a cat a compliment and they ran away crying, I'd probably be a little confused.

intro: [t_c comes in from the hunting patrol, staring at their paws self-consciously as the rest of the patrol adds their catches to the freshkill pile.]
[tm_n gently reassures them that they tried their best, but t_c just glances away, clearly upset.]
How am I ever gonna be a real warrior if I can't even catch my own prey ...?
comfort: [You tell t_c that everyone struggles with hunting sometimes and they'll get the hang of it eventually.]
You're telling me you noticed I did bad on my patrol?
[They look at you for a second, eyes wide and impressionable, then look away.]
[Seems they didn't respond well to your sympathy.]
leave_alone: [You decide to not embarrass t_c any further.]

intro: [t_c watches tm_n apprehensively from across camp.]
Do you think tm_n even likes me?
It seems like, every new skill they try and teach me, I always seem to mess it up somehow ...
I just hope I'm not making them look like a bad mentor.
comfort: [You purr to t_c that, even if their mentor doesn't like them, it doesn't change the fact that they're trying their best, which is all that matters.]
Still, I just hope they won't flunk my warrior's assessment!
[They look back at tm_n with a fearful gaze.]
confidently_reassure: [You assure t_c that of course their mentor likes them.]
Ah, I don't know, y_c ... No offense, but you haven't been to one of our training sessions.
They just get so frustrated with me ... I don't know how any cat could still like me after all that.
[They look back at tm_n with a somber gaze.]
criticize: [You tell t_c that maybe they wouldn't have to stress so much if they put the time in to master the skills tm_n taught them.]
Ah ... You think that's really true?
It already feels like I have to work a million times harder than any other apprentice, just to get by. Why does everyone else get to have it so easy?
[They look back at tm_n with a resentful gaze.]

intro: Hey... y_c? W- What if l_n doesn't make me a warrior because I'm too much of a fraidy cat, like r_c said?
[t_c starts to tear up, trembling in place.]

choice1.text: They really said that to you?!

choice2.text: Of course you'll get to be a warrior!

choice3.text: Maybe it'd help if you were braver.

comfort: Well ... Maybe it's not exactly what they said, but I know that they meant it!
I don't know how all the other kits are so excited to become warriors.
I guess, even if I didn't end up a warrior, it wouldn't be so bad.
confident_reassurance: Oh ... But what if I don't even wanna be a warrior? What if I mess everything up?
I don't know how the other kits find all of this so easy ...
Even the thought of becoming an apprentice makes me feel all dizzy!
criticize: Eep! Do you really think so?
I'm never gonna become a warrior at this rate!

intro: [t_c coldly drops a bird at your paws.]
Before you ask, yes, I did go onto the territory without your permission.
It was early morning. This bird was perching in camp and I chased after it. There was no time to wake you.
If you have a problem with it, I'd recommend taking it up with d_n.
But I'm not gonna apologize, because I'm not sorry.
praise_apprentice: [You compliment t_c on their initiative. They blink, surprised, then break into a rare smile.]
Guess I'll just put this on the freshkill pile, then. Hehe.
scold_apprentice: [You chastise t_c on their flippant attitude.]
Tch. I already told you, I don't care.
I got the bird, just like you taught me! It was an advanced catch! Shouldn't you be proud of me?
I can guarantee you, whoever eats this bird is gonna be grateful. But if you'd rather grab it out of their mouth because it was caught 'illegally', be my guest.
[t_c stalks off, coldly dropping the bird on the freshkill pile. Seems like you'll have to find another way to discipline them.]

intro: Hey, y_c, I'll give you a badger ride if you go up to r_w and call them a huge piece of fox dung.
okay: Great! Remember, it's 'Huge piece of fox-dung.' Sound it out. Perfect! Now, go!
[You do as you're told, repeating the words to r_w as t_c dies of laughter on the other end of camp.]
Ahh, that is just too good! Hehehehe!
why: Uhm, because it's hilarious? I thought you kits weren't supposed to ask questions.
Now, c'mon, squirt, are you gonna do it or not?
no_way: Man, kits these days are way harder to trick than I remember ...

intro: [t_c is narrating a grand tale as they chase snowflakes around camp. Instead of interrupting them, you decide to eavesdrop and figure out exactly what adventures they're on today.]
And t_c gets one!
And another!
And they're dropping like flies! The hunt is on, everybody!
With t_c in the lead with a whopping 147 catches, we're looking at the most exciting mouse-hunt game of the season!
[Then, t_c stops, looking you directly in the eye. You can't tell if they're embarrassed or waiting for a response.]

choice1.text: Give them a yelp of encouragement!

choice2.text: Accept the challenge and bite a snowflake yourself.

choice3.text: Roll your eyes and walk away.

yelp_of_encouragement: Yeaah!! And the crowd goes WILD!
accept_challenge: Well, brace yourself, y_c, for I am the unbeaten snowflake CHAMPION!
[You and t_c have an all-out snowflake battle, chasing each others' tails with your scores the entire time. At the end, you narrowly come out on top!]
Awh man! The best has been bested, after all.
Well, congrats, you've done the impossible!
walk_away: [t_c almost seems to wilt for a moment, before shaking their head and looking back up at all the falling snowflakes.]
Well, heroes aren't always congratulated, are they?
[t_c goes back to what they were doing, but you notice they aren't narrating it anymore.]

intro: Hm... y_c, you know what?
I don't think I know enough about you. And I can't tolerate that!
See, I have lists of a buncha stuff about all the cats I like, and I only have a couple things in my mind list for you.
[t_c makes a little "click-click" sound with their tongue, but you don't know what it's trying to emulate.]
So, whaddaya do in your free time?

choice1.text: I don't really get a lot of that.

not_much_free_time: My goodness! I mean, I kinda figured, but we gotta change that!
Come on. We can collect rocks and play Clans with them!
And I'll help you make your character. You can be, uh... a rogue. And your name can be something rogues would name themselves.
Like... Snuffles. Or Rouge. Or the Dragonborn.
its_secret: Ohhhh... I get it now. Forbidden romance?
[A staggering silence then follows; you have absolutely no idea what you're even supposed to say to this accusation.]
...What? I thought everyone was doing that nowadays. It's like the hot new thing when you don't know what to do with your life.
Or maybe I'm telling on myself.

choice2.text: I like to help cats with other roles.

choice3.text: Bathe in the blood of those who've wronged me?

collecting: Woah! Actually, I have a small collection myself...
I like to collect rocks and give them names. And then I play Clans with them!
You should meet Pebblestar. He killed his mate Brightstream because he started to catch onto the fact that Pebblestar was immorally spying on cats. Hehe.
helping: Woah! See, y_c, this is why you're a cool cat.
You're always going around and helping cats. That's, like, really admirable!
Last time I tried to help r_c I fell on my face.
murder: Hehe. You've gotta teach me how to be so convincing sometime, y_c. I'm really glad you're kidding, though!
[t_c giggles, eventually sighing when they're done.]
We really are the best of buds, you and me.

intro: y_c! y_c! I wanna play a game with you!
So, I'm thinking of a blue thing right now. And if you guess what the blue thing is, I'll give it to you.

choice4.text: I don't want to play this!

correct: Yep. I found a peacock feather, and I want you to have it.
[t_c leads you to their den, where they pluck a peacock feather from their nest and nestle it into the fur of your flank. Considering your size, it's almost bigger than you!]
Those guys are one of my favorites because they do pretty dances.
And they kind of remind me of you because you sure do love to squirm! Hehe.
cancel: Well, it was a peacock feather! I found it earlier when I was out strolling and I thought you would like it.
I guess your parent's gotta get better games to impress their kit, huh?

intro: Hey y_c, before you head out, you did remember to clean out the den you were assigned, right?
[With a sinking feeling in your stomach, you realize that you forgot to clean out the nursery earlier that day. What should you say?]
lie: [You make up an elaborate lie about how you and r_a had tried to clean it earlier that day.]
Is that so? Because last I checked, r_a has been out on a hunting patrol since dawn.
[t_c proceeds to give you a long and stern lecture about the importance of honesty and owning up to one's mistakes. Afterward, you are sent off to clean the entire den alone.]
admit: [Although t_c isn't exactly happy, they appreciate your honesty.]
I'll tell you what. Go get some moss from the medicine den and meet me by the nursery. I'll lend you a paw and replace the nests, while you fix up the walls and clear any debris.
Afterward, we'll go out and catch some prey for the clan. Sound like a plan?

intro: Look, I'd rather be eating a toad right now than speaking to you, but... we're still clanmates, and clanmates should at least try and tolerate one another, right?
So... here.
[t_c tosses a mouse at your paws and watches you expectantly. It seems like they're waiting for a response.]
thank: [t_c gives you a curt nod and, although they don't say it to you directly, you swear you can hear a soft 'welcome.' as they pad away.]
ignore: [t_c lashes their tail and stalks off without another word.]
insult: [t_c growls and snatches the mouse straight out of your paws.]
I don't know what your deal is, but c_nClan can't afford to have its clanmates at each other's throats. Pull yourself together and stop acting like a kit.
I'd hate to see you drive more of your clanmates away.

intro: [You're dragging a large pile of moss across the camp, intent on delivering it to the medicine den. t_c spots you in the middle of your task and perks up, racing over.]
y_c! y_c! Need a helping paw? I'm super good at carrying moss, I swear!
[t_c stares up at you with wide eyes, eagerly awaiting your response.]
away: [You shrug t_c off and tell them to go back to the nursery. t_c looks hurt but doesn't protest as they slowly pad away with their head hung low.]
accept: [You graciously accept t_c's offer and slide them a portion of your moss. With their head held high and an extra spring in their step, the two of you successfully deliver the moss to the medicine den.]

intro: Hey there y_c, what's up? Do you need anything?

choice2.text: Can you give me a badger ride!

battle: Oh, sorry y_c, I'm in a bit of a time crunch right now. I have to gather some moss for r_m and help r_a patch up the apprentice den, all before sunset!
But first, I have to go join r_w's patrol.
beg: No way! You know the rules, and I am not putting my tail on the line so you can frolic around outside of camp.
What if you got lost? What if you ran into a big, hungry fox? These rules are here for a reason, t_c. I don't want you to get hurt.
badger: [t_c shakes their head, sighing as they crouch low enough for you to climb onto their back.]
...Fine. Here, climb onto my shoulder and- hey! Careful with those claws!
[You hook your claws into their fur, squealing with delight as they lumber around the clearing.]

intro: Ughhh, when can I get out of this boring old camp already? I want to go out and catch all of the mouses and defend our territory from stinky o_cClan cats!

choice2.text: Are you ready for your apprenticeship?

apprentice: You bet!! I'm gonna be the best apprentice in the entire clan; just you wait!

intro: Oh, my love! Good morning! How are you feeling today? Hopefully well?
I actually have a question, if you wouldn't mind?
Do you think I'm a little too... nice sometimes? I- I know I don't need to worry about it but...
r_w has been saying I'm a total pushover and... I suppose it got to me.

choice2.text: You're perfect the way you are!

toonice: Oh... I see. Thank you for being honest with me.
[They seem... really upset. However, they give you the same smile they always do.]
youreperfect: Oh love! You're so sweet! ... Thank you, I really needed that.
